intro: Chamaepericlymenum suecicum, commonly known as the Swedish meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial with delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically reaches a height of about 10-20 cm and has basal leaves that are palmately lobed. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for gardeners interested in native flora.
